page.title: 05MARSTON VALES' ECOLOGY
page.content: THE ECOSYSTEM IN THIS BLOCK PROVIDES A WIDE RANGE OF HABITATS,IS MILD IN CLIMATE AND IS NOT POLLUTED.THE AREA IS CROSSED BY FOOTPATHS AND BRIDLEWAYS ALLOWING ACCESS TO ALL PARTS.THERE ARE A FEW SMALL PONDS AND COPSES THAT ARE UNDISTURBED.THE EXCAVATION OF CLAY BY THE BRICKWORKS FROM 150 ACRES HAS FORMED A LARGE LAKE,STOCKED WITH COARSE FISH;NUMEROUS TREES HAVE BEEN PLANTED AND LARGE PLOTS LEFT TO NATURALISE ATTRACTING WATERBIRDS, AMPHIBIANS,INSECTS AND MAMMALS.THE VAST MAJORITYTOF THE VALE IS FARMED FOR CASH CROPS,THE HEDGEROWS PROVIDING THE ONLY STABLE HABITAT FOR FAUNA AND FLORA DUE TO THE USE OF HERBICIDES AND PESTICIDES.THE WOODS ON JACKDAW HILL ARE MAINLY CONIFEROUS AND PROVIDE SHELTER FOR LARGER MAMMALS AND A WIDE VARIETY OF BIRDS.
